posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Singer and Spell-Slinger

Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/dd/0c/f9 ... eafd6d.jpg

Build details:
My friend @Aquarius 233 challenged me in game on WoG today, told me I couldn't make a Bard-orcerer as good as he could (as he is currently the world authority on Bard-orcerers at present), and told me he would love to see my attempt on the ECB forum.

[Sorry that was an attempt at humor. Move on if you didn't get it.]

Anyway there are some cool things about Bard-orcerers. One is the Bard song which immediately makes you popular with everyone. Second is the huge number of spells/day and spells available to use. Third is that you dont have to memorise your spells just rest whenever and you can cast whatever you want whenever.

There are weaknesses of course. I've tried to address some of them. Firstly the build is feat starved. I felt the best approach would be to abandon all thoughts of being a combatant, avoiding all those feats like Blind Fight/Knockdown/WF/EWF/EP, and embrace the lifestyle of being a singer and spell-slinger hence the title.

[Although he could also equip a sling as well to be a singer, slinger and spell-slinger, he is going to be an inaccurate slinger.]

Bard/ Sorcerer have atrocious d4/d6 hit die so I've opted for a cons based non-DC spell caster, add EDR III.

Dispels are the final issue I can see. I've opted for undispellability (at level 40) which is pretty standard for a spellsword to get this late 30s-40 but will need to be managed carefully avoiding dispels until you get to 40 by which time you can retire the character (lol). 

Damage shields would be strong here with extended wounding whispers, death armor, flame shield and mestil's acid sheath, although not having critical hit immunity will be problematic, one might have to utilise the Shapechange (Iron Golem) approach if you want to use this optimally, until Epic Spell: Epic Warding is obtained.

I definitely wanted a level 16 Bard/Curse Song in the build, just too powerful to give up.

Heaps of craft magic in the build (Scribe Scroll/craft wand), with dual spell books seemed silly not to take it, and will make you even more popular than you already were. 

Somehow I fit in the ability to set and craft deadly traps into the build which is nice too. 

Anyway this guy is looking like a bit of a 'rock star', feel free to review, suggestions/tweaks always welcome

Certainly achievable. I think Mummy dust requires Sorc 21+ so simply put Bard 16 to level 37+ and this should work, even with a releveling wand / Mulligan Stick
Curious as to why its called a Mulligan Stick. Was it a coder by the name of Mulligan who scripted the item? 

Edit:
I really like the idea of dropping those two great constitution feats for other stuff, its got enough HP already for a non-frontliner
Epic Spell Penetration is a great choice, get that SP up to 30+1d20 for 5% failure against max toolset SR 32, you are a spell slinger at heart
As for the remaining feat I'm thinking ESF: Concentration, ESF: Listen, Brew Potion (to put True Strike, Death Armor, War Cry and Wounding Whispers on tap for your party), Epic Reflexes, Maximize/Still Spell, even toughness for zero net HP loss but extra HP for your polymorphed forms.

By the way the 'vanilla' Mummy Dust spell is simply awful.
The warrior has 13 hit die if my math is correct (143 HP / [10+1] = 13). 
The DC of the fear aura would be 10+ 4 (1/3 hit die) = 14.
They haven't posted the stats of the improved Mummy Dust on the WoG website, would be interesting to know.

I find this an interesting thread with a bit unusual character concept and even a challenge!

I looked back in my folders and found
SpoilerBard(16), Sorcerer(24), Human DEX: 16 (26) WIS: 8 CHA: 16 (19) 01: Bard(1): Curse Song, Lingering Song 03: Bard(3): Weapon Finesse 05: Bard(5) 07: Bard(7) 09: Sorcerer(1): Extend Spell 11: Sorcerer(3) 13: Sorcerer(4) 15: Sorcerer(6): Spell Penetration 17: Bard(10) 19: Bard(11) 21: Sorcerer(9): Epic Weapon Focus 23: Sorcerer(10) 25: Sorcerer(12) 27: Bard(14): Epic Skill Focus: Discipline 29: Sorcerer(15) 31: Sorcerer(17) 33: Sorcerer(18): Great Dexterity II, (DEX=23) 35: Sorcerer(20) 37: Sorcerer(22) 39: Sorcerer(24): Epic Spell Penetration Saving Throw bonuses: Spells: +9 AB (max, naked): 35 (melee), 32 (ranged) Spell Casting: Bard(6),Sorcerer(9) Concentration 42(42), Discipline 43(53), Perform 26(30), Spellcraft 43(45), Taunt 43(47), Tumble 40(48), UMD 16(20)
 
It never became a candidate for the 40s section, but it can serve as a comparison here. My goal was to try to make a spellsword with undispellable Sorcerer magic and the lvl 16 Bard songs.
I chose to let the mage part focus primarily on non save spells with the low DC and a fair chance to penetrate the standard item based SR 32. The combat part is dex based and AB is OK'ish. It  improves with taunt and the songs active. Damage relies heavily on buffs.
Damage shields work best in golem shape with the added immunities and hitpoints.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
That looks really cool Mick, and I did consider a Dex based Bard-o-sorcerer for a while, although I had a bow or crossbow in mind, in vanilla NWN these can't be buffed by GMW etc so your approach is probably more optimal there.
I would be tempted to drop Dex to 14 (-1AB/-1AC) and put Cons to 14 and take Toughness instead of ESF: Discipline for instant +120hp to get him up to 312 base HP
Suddenly with empowered Endurance active he looks like a very very very useful support character!
Curse/Bard song is really strong, with +7 effective AB/AC that Base AB 34 is more like 41 AB
Thanks for digging this one up from your files, much appreciated

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Ah so here it is!
Thank you for having posted it, as you said I was eager to read how is the "bard-orcerer" v2!
This seems much more similar to the build I mentioned in my thread, as it is a support caster.
I have reviewed mine and I think this is the best solution for this class combo as the feat-starveness makes very difficult to obtain the auto-still feats.
Therefore, if one really wants to use the bard-orcerer as a spellsword, either one uses particular armors or accepts to bear the risk of spell failure (highly unlikely as we are talking about an half-caster).

I would like to see him growing in a team (Bardorcerer team ;) )
